Key Match Events: Davis Schneider hit a two-run homer in the fourth
Nathan Lukes hit a double in the eighth inning to drive home George Springer with the eventual winning run
Chad Green picked up his 17th save
Pre-Game Insights: Manager John Schneider said that any sweep is huge in the league and that it's hard to do, especially against three veteran pitchers
Post-Match Reflections: Schneider said that the goal from the beginning of the year to now doesn't change, regardless of what the standings say, it's to win as many games as you can
Schneider said that he's proud of the team for 'out-energizing' some of their opponents and that there's a desire to re-acquaint themselves with the feeling of winning games consistently
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Jays used five relievers after Rodriguez came out in the fifth
The Cards twice elected to put Vladimir Guerrero Jr. on base with first base open and took their chances with Horwitz, hitting in the clean-up spot behind him
It was the Jays' fifth sweep of the season and third at home this year
